member.summary: If true the the WS_EX_NOACTIVATE style will be removed so that future mouse clicks inside the browser correctly activate and focus the window.

member.summary: Browser initialization settings

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is disposed.
member.value: if this instance is disposed; otherwise, .

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.BrowserSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the browser settings.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.ActivateBrowserOnCreation
member.summary: Activates browser upon creation, the default value is false. Prior to version 73 the default behaviour was to activate browser on creation (Equivalent of setting this property to true). To restore this behaviour set this value to true immediately after you create the instance. https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/issues/1856/branch-2526-cef-activates-browser-window

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.RequestContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the request context.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsLoading
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the control is currently loading one or more web pages (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is loading; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.TooltipText
member.summary: The text that will be displayed as a ToolTip

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.Address
member.summary: The address (URL) which the browser control is currently displaying. Will automatically be updated as the user navigates to another page (e.g. by clicking on a link).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.AddressChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser address changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.TitleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser title changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanGoForward
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control currently supports the GoForward action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go forward; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanGoBack
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control current supports the GoBack action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go back; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsBrowserInitialized
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the WebBrowser is initialized (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is browser initialized; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.UseParentFormMessageInterceptor
member.summary: ParentFormMessageInterceptor hooks the Form handle and forwards the move/active messages to the browser, the default is true and should only be required when using set to true.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.ParkControlOnHandleDestroyed
member.summary: By default when is called the underlying Browser Hwnd is only parked (moved to a temp parent) when is true, there are a few other cases where parking of the control is desired, you can force parking by setting this property to true.
member.remarks: You may wish to set this property to true when using the browser in conjunction with https://github.com/dockpanelsuite/dockpanelsuite

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.FocusHandler
member.summary: The for this ChromiumWebBrowser.
member.remarks: If you need customized focus handling behavior for WinForms, the suggested best practice would be to inherit from DefaultFocusHandler and try to avoid needing to override the logic in OnGotFocus. The implementation in DefaultFocusHandler relies on very detailed behavior of how WinForms and Windows interact during window activation.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.DragHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to dragging.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.ResourceRequestHandlerFactory
member.summary: Implement and control the loading of resources

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.LoadError
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the resource load for a navigation fails or is canceled. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.FrameLoadStart
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser begins loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method may not be called for a particular frame if the load request for that frame fails. For notification of overall browser load status use OnLoadingStateChange instead. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.
member.remarks: Whilst this may seem like a logical place to execute js, it's called before the DOM has been loaded, implement as it's called when the underlying V8Context is created

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.FrameLoadEnd
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser is done loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method will always be called for all frames irrespective of whether the request completes successfully. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.LoadingStateChanged
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the Loading state has changed. This event will be fired twice. Once when loading is initiated either programmatically or by user action, and once when loading is terminated due to completion, cancellation of failure. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.ConsoleMessage
member.summary: Event handler for receiving Javascript console messages being sent from web pages. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when you're running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.StatusMessage
member.summary: Event handler for changes to the status message. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when you're running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.JavascriptMessageReceived
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the message that originates from CefSharp.PostMessage

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Experimental.ChromiumRenderWidgetHandleFinder.TryFindHandle(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Chromium's message-loop Window isn't created synchronously, so this may not find it. If so, you need to wait and try again later.
member.param: ChromiumWebBrowser instance
Handle of the child HWND with the name
member.returns: returns true if the HWND was found otherwise false.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Experimental.ChromiumRenderWidgetHandleFinder.TryFindHandle(CefSharp.IBrowser,System.IntPtr@)

member.param: IBrowser instance
Handle of the child HWND with the name
member.returns: returns true if the HWND was found otherwise false.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Experimental.ChromiumRenderWidgetHandleFinder.TryFindHandle(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Helper function used to find the child HWND with the ClassName matching Chromium's message-loop Window isn't created synchronously, so this may not find it. If so, you need to wait and try again later. In most cases you should use the overload.
member.param: control Handle
class name used to match
Handle of the child HWND with the name
member.returns: returns true if the HWND was found otherwise false.

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.DisplayHandler
member.summary: A WinForms Specific implementation that simplifies the process of hosting a Popup as a Control/Tab. Use this implementation as a base for your own custom implementation if you are using

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.OnBeforePopupCreatedDelegate
member.summary: Called beforethe popup is created, can be used to cancel popup creation if required or modify . It's important to note that the methods of this interface are called on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread.
member.param: the ChromiumWebBrowser control
The browser instance that launched this popup.
The HTML frame that launched this popup.
The URL of the popup content. (This may be empty/null)
The name of the popup. (This may be empty/null)
The value indicates where the user intended to open the popup (e.g. current tab, new tab, etc)
The value will be true if the popup was opened via explicit user gesture (e.g. clicking a link) or false if the popup opened automatically (e.g. via the DomContentLoaded event).
browser settings, defaults to source browsers
member.returns: To cancel creation of the popup return true otherwise return false.

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.OnPopupCreatedDelegate
member.summary: Called when the has been created. When called you must add the control to it's intended parent so the can be calculated to set the initial size correctly.
member.param: popup host control
url

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.OnPopupBrowserCreatedDelegate
member.summary: Called when the instance has been created. The reference will be valid until is called
member.param: popup host control, maybe null if Browser is hosted in a native Popup window. DevTools by default will be hosted in a native popup window.
browser

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.OnPopupDestroyedDelegate
member.summary: Called when the is to be removed from it's parent. When called you must remove/dispose of the .
member.param: popup host control
browser

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.CreatePopupChromiumHostControl
member.summary: Called to create a new instance of . Allows creation of a derived implementation of .
member.returns: A custom instance of .

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.LifeSpanHandler
member.summary: A WinForms Specific implementation that simplifies the process of hosting a Popup as a Control/Tab. This implementation returns true in so no WM_CLOSE message is sent, this differs from the default CEF behaviour.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.LifeSpanHandler.OnBeforePopup(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IBrowser,CefSharp.IFrame,System.String,System.String,CefSharp.WindowOpenDisposition,System.Boolean,CefSharp.IPopupFeatures,CefSharp.IWindowInfo,CefSharp.IBrowserSettings,System.Boolean@,CefSharp.IWebBrowser@)
member.remarks: NOTE: DevTools popups DO NOT trigger OnBeforePopup.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.LifeSpanHandler.OnBeforePopupCreated(CefSharp.WinForms.Handler.OnBeforePopupCreatedDelegate)
member.summary: The will be called before the popup has been created and can be used to cancel popup creation if required or modify .
member.param: Action to be invoked before popup is created.
member.returns: instance allowing you to chain method calls together

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl
member.summary: Chromium Browser Host Control, used for hosting Popups in WinForms

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.BrowserCore
member.summary: Get access to the core instance. Maybe null if the underlying CEF Browser has not yet been created or if this control has been disposed. Check before accessing.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.LoadError
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the resource load for a navigation fails or is canceled. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.FrameLoadStart
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser begins loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method may not be called for a particular frame if the load request for that frame fails. For notification of overall browser load status use OnLoadingStateChange instead. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.
member.remarks: Whilst this may seem like a logical place to execute js, it's called before the DOM has been loaded, implement as it's called when the underlying V8Context is created

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.FrameLoadEnd
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser is done loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method will always be called for all frames irrespective of whether the request completes successfully. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.LoadingStateChanged
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the Loading state has changed. This event will be fired twice. Once when loading is initiated either programmatically or by user action, and once when loading is terminated due to completion, cancellation of failure. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.ConsoleMessage
member.summary: Event handler for receiving Javascript console messages being sent from web pages. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when you're running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.StatusMessage
member.summary: Event handler for changes to the status message. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when you're running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.AddressChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser address changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.TitleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser title changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.IsLoading
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the control is currently loading one or more web pages (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is loading; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.Address
member.summary: The address (URL) which the browser control is currently displaying. Will automatically be updated as the user navigates to another page (e.g. by clicking on a link).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.CanGoForward
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control currently supports the GoForward action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go forward; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.CanGoBack
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control current supports the GoBack action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go back; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl.IsBrowserInitialized
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the WebBrowser is initialized (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is browser initialized; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Called when the browser component has received focus.
member.param: the ChromiumWebBrowser control
the browser object
member.remarks: Try to avoid needing to override this logic in a subclass. The implementation in DefaultFocusHandler relies on very detailed behavior of how WinForms and Windows interact during window activation.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Internals.DefaultFocusHandler.OnSetFocus(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IBrowser,CefSharp.CefFocusSource)
member.summary: Called when the browser component is requesting focus.

the browser object
Indicates where the focus request is originating from.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Internals.DefaultFocusHandler.OnTakeFocus(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IBrowser,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when the browser component is about to lose focus. For instance, if focus was on the last HTML element and the user pressed the TAB key.
member.param: the ChromiumWebBrowser control
the browser object
Will be true if the browser is giving focus to the next component and false if the browser is giving focus to the previous component.

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.WebBrowserExtensions
member.summary: Helper extensions for performing common CefSharp related WinForms tasks

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.WebBrowserExtensions.DestroyWindow(CefSharp.IChromiumWebBrowserBase)
member.summary: Manually call https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-destroywindow passing in the handle returned from . This method can be used to manually close the underlying CefBrowser instance. This will avoid the WM_Close message that CEF sends by default to the top level window. (Which closes your application). This method should generally only be used in the WinForms version.
member.param: the or instance.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.WebBrowserExtensions.ShowDevToolsDocked(CefSharp.IChromiumWebBrowserBase,System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.String,System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Open DevTools using as the parent control. If inspectElementAtX and/or inspectElementAtY are specified then the element at the specified (x,y) location will be inspected. For resize/moving to work correctly you will need to use the implementation. (Set to an instance of )
member.param: instance
Control used as the parent for DevTools (a custom control will be added to the collection)
x coordinate (used for inspectElement)
y coordinate (used for inspectElement)
member.returns: Returns the that hosts the DevTools instance if successful, otherwise returns null on error.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.WebBrowserExtensions.ShowDevToolsDocked(CefSharp.IChromiumWebBrowserBase,System.Action{CefSharp.WinForms.Host.ChromiumHostControl},System.String,System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Open DevTools using your own Control as the parent. If inspectElementAtX and/or inspectElementAtY are specified then the element at the specified (x,y) location will be inspected. For resize/moving to work correctly you will need to use the implementation. (Set to an instance of )
member.param: instance

Action that is Invoked when the DevTools Host Control has been created and needs to be added to it's parent. It's important the control is added to it's intended parent at this point so the can be calculated to set the initial display size.
x coordinate (used for inspectElement)
y coordinate (used for inspectElement)
member.returns: Returns the that hosts the DevTools instance if successful, otherwise returns null on error.
